questions.question_text: Which of the following options is accepted as a Column field name in Document Manager?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The field does not accept uppercase letters. It can only contain lowercase letters, numbers, underscore _ and dash -.

questions.question_text: What do entity predictions refer to within UiPath Communications Mining?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The identification of a specific span of text as a value for a particular entity type

choices.B: The difference between label suggestions and label predictions in a training process.
choices.C: The identification of a specific span of text as a value for a particular entity type.
choices.D: The model's confidence that a specific concept exists within a communication.
choices.A: The understanding of the parent-label relationship when assigning label predictions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The Taxonomy is the metadata that the Document Understanding framework considers in each of its steps. A Taxonomy is a collection of Document Types. A Document Type is the definition of a logical type of document, that must be handled by different business processes.

questions.question_text: How is the Taxonomy component used in the Document Understanding Template?

choices.C: To organize knowledge by using a controlled vocabulary to make it easier to find related information.
choices.A: To define the document types and the pieces of information targeted for data extraction (fields) for each document type.
choices.B: To apply rigor in the taxonomy of data, ensuring any newly discovered object fits into one and only one category or object.
choices.D: To apply relationship schemas other than parent-child hierarchies, such as network structures on the processed data.
12 documents for training the model, and 3 for evaluating the model.
choices.C: 10 documents for training the model, and 5 for evaluating the model.
choices.A: 7 documents for training the model, and 8 for evaluating the model.
choices.B: 8 documents for training the model, and 7 for evaluating the model.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
80% for training and 20% for evaluation

Selected Answer: D
should be D. 80% for training and 20% for evaluation
But I think the proportion is 80% training data and 20% evaluation data. So in my opinion, the answer should be D. i.e 12 documents for training and 3 documents for evaluation.

questions.question_text: What is the recommended split of documents for training and evaluation, considering a total of 15 documents per vendor?

choices.B: Using the AI Center model builder.
choices.C: Using a Python IDE (Integrated Development Environment) or an AutoML platform.
choices.D: Using a C/C++ IDE (Integrated Development Environment), then upload the code to Al Center IDE.
choices.A: Using the AI Center IDE (Integrated Development Environment).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Building ML Packages
The data scientists build pre-trained, models using Python or using an AutoML platform. Those models are consumed by RPA developers within a workflow.
